page.title: 13The Herts and Bucks Border
page.content: Chorleywood is a town divided by the Herts-Bucks County Border which splits the community into two. On one side is Bckinghamshire which has a shopping centre and one middle school. Chorleywood Herts has two primary schools and a secondary schhol. SERVICES-Ambulance, police and fire come from Rickmansworth for Herts and from Amersham for the Bucks side.PARISH COUNCILS-Chorleywood is covered by 3 Parish Councils which are Chenies based at St. Michaels, Chorleywood based at Christ Church and St. Peters based at St. Peters Church. Both counties have plans to move the County Boundary. Chiltern Council want to extend their border to the new M25 and make Chorleywood all Buckinghamshire, while Three Rivers Council want to extend their border to the Rickmansworth Road and make Chorleywood all Herts.
